poem:
Milwaukee Arrival

Trump descends
into Milwaukee's spell,
gunfire echoing
like ghostly notes
through the crowd's throng,
bodies trembling
at the brush of death—
a nation sways
on a political tightrope,
fragile yet fierce,
unfolding its fears
in the day's 
uncertain light.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
